page.title: 10Whittlebury Ghost Stories
page.content: A huntsman wearing a red jacket and riding a horse is said to enter number 12, High Street three or four times a year, passing through the dairy wall at the north end of the house. He is believed to be a friendly spirit, but causes an inexplicable, cold sensation by his presence. He is dated after 1890 because, prior to that, green was worn by the local Grafton Hunt, now at Paulerspury. Returning from work on a moped after passing a row of old cottages along Cow Pastures lane, a local lady had a strange experience. A dark shape crossed the road in front of her. Later at the Records Office it was revealed a Vicar had been murdered on that date at that very place over 100 years ago, on 30th November.
